title: SUSTAIN THE ARTS (stART) FUND (PROGRAMME FUNDING)
about: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund provides funding to arts organisations to help create and present quality programmes that contribute to the vibrancy of Singapore's arts and culture ecosystem. Such programmes include those with community impact that enable more people to enjoy the arts, enhance the arts experience through digital technology, and encourage audiences to reflect on and celebrate Singapore's cultural identity.
who_can_apply:
Arts organisations who are registered with Commissioner of Charities (COC), Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority of Singapore (ACRA) or the Registry of Societies (ROS), and have total operating expenditure (TOE) of below $1M based on last audited financial statements.
Arts organisations with Institution of Public Character (IPC) status with a TOE below $1M are eligible for the stART Fund programme track. However, they are only allowed to receive funding from the stART Fund for one cycle.
when_to_apply: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund is open for application once a year. The 2026 cycle will be from 5th January 2026 to 27th February 2026.
funding: Successful applications to the Programme track may receive a fund quantum between $20,000 to $50,000.
how_to_apply: Completing the grant application should take about 30 mins with all the information on hand. All fields are mandatory unless otherwise stated.

sections.heading: About this grant
content: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund provides funding to arts organisations to help create and present quality programmes that contribute to the vibrancy of Singapore's arts and culture ecosystem. Such programmes include those with community impact that enable more people to enjoy the arts, enhance the arts experience through digital technology, and encourage audiences to reflect on and celebrate Singapore's cultural identity.

sections.heading: Who can apply?
content: Arts organisations who are registered with Commissioner of Charities (COC), Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority of Singapore (ACRA) or the Registry of Societies (ROS), and have total operating expenditure (TOE) of below $1M based on last audited financial statements.

Arts organisations with Institution of Public Character (IPC) status with a TOE below $1M are eligible for the stART Fund programme track. However, they are only allowed to receive funding from the stART Fund for one cycle.

sections.heading: When can I apply?
content: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund is open for application once a year. The 2026 cycle will be from 5th January 2026 to 27th February 2026.

sections.heading: How much funding can you receive?
content: Successful applications to the Programme track may receive a fund quantum between $20,000 to $50,000.

sections.heading: How to apply?
content: Completing the grant application should take about 30 mins with all the information on hand. All fields are mandatory unless otherwise stated.

documents_required.label: stART Fund Budget Sheet Template (XLSX 141 KB)
